title: Ticket #5419: PreCmd / PostCmd should behave more like condor_dagman
description:
This URI describes the problems I have in recommending the use of PreCmd/PostCmd in condor_submit as an alternative to PRE and POST scripts in condor_dagman. I prefer to avoid DAG PRE/POST scripts as they run on the submit host itself and are therefore, for any scripts of modest CPU utilization, act as a rate limiter for large DAGs.

https://spinningmatt.wordpress.com/2012/10/29/pre-and-post-job-scripts/

Problems:

  1. Must buy-in fully to condor file transfer. Cannot specify absolute path to pre/post cmd.
  2. should_transfer_files = if_needed does not recognize that you have added PreCmd/PostCmd to the submit file. Only "yes" will transfer the files. Maybe this isn't a bug, but it's not what I expected.
  3. Exit code behavior is not the same as a DAG PRE/POST script in that the job will run even if the PreCmd exits with a failure. Ditto for exiting queue when PostCmd fails.
